body_html:
Integral dtypes are inherently discrete... So about every DL framework use floating points because they need gradients.

The problem is that my data is MRI, when converting the image into float, the visualization results get strange… I do not know if this is because of the viewer or from pytorch… I check the value between different datatype, float or int8, the value did not change, (e.g., 144.0 to 144).

If this is standard RGB image we are talking about, you need to divide by 255 after casting into float.
